sentence.Network_en: Only lazybones and mediocre persons could hanker after the days of messing together.
sentence.Network_cn: 只有懒汉庸才才会留恋那大锅饭的年代.

sentence.Network_en: At last Jack began to hanker after a little excitement.
sentence.Network_cn: 后来,杰克又渴望找点儿刺激了.

sentence.Network_en: I don't hanker after squirrel meat.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: probably related to hang; compare with Dutch hunkeren

entry.def: If you hanker after something, you want it very much.

example.ex: I hankered after a floor-length brown suede coat.
example.tran: 我渴望有一件长及脚跟的棕色绒面革大衣。

auth_sentence.content: The rest of us might hanker for just a stitch or two more of her pleasing dry wit.
auth_sentence.res_content: The rest of us might hanker for just a stitch or two more of her pleasing dry wit.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The rest of us might hanker for just a stitch or two more of her pleasing dry wit.

auth_sentence.content: In fact, in this unsettled era of social media, we seem to hanker all the more after food that anchors us and makes us feel safe.
auth_sentence.res_content: In fact, in this unsettled era of social media, we seem to hanker all the more after food that anchors us and makes us feel safe.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In fact, in this unsettled era of social media, we seem to hanker all the more after food that anchors us and makes us feel safe.

sentences.en: He hankered after big city life.
I still hankered for the farm life.
